characters: SUBJECTS DESCRIBE DEMONIC VISIONS, HYSTERICAL RAGE...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pristine, empty frame.   Clean and peaceful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaven is a place where nothing ever happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's gentle motion in the blank frame, like swirling 1 grain. A RUMBLE starts to build, low but growing louder..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grain moves faster, big chunks fluttering, now a dirt dishwater grey. The RUMBLE becoming a HOWLING WIND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Churning black water LAPS at the bottom of the frame...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blizzard, at the peak of its power. Visibility zero, Ne York reduced to the hulking shapes of buildings on the ba MAX PAYNE thrashes in the water, a long way from shore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an army of bodies under this river. Criminals, people who ran out of time, out of friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chunks of ice float in the dirty water around him. Max's body freezing, skin turning blue. Heavy winter clothes saturating, like an anchor dragging him down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next time they drag this river, they'll find me on the bottom with the rest of them. And there won't be anybody left to say I was different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's face sinks below the surface...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to orient us to the location, the time. Just a fl of golden light filling the hall, warm as the river was c Around a closed door, sunlight streams through the gaps..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN sleeps on the bed, curled up around a bundled BAB Is this the final, peaceful memory of a drowning man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's wrong, then: the woman's body in an unnatural position, more thrown than laid across the bed. The crib tipped over, blankets scattered. Her eyes frozen open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something BLACK flutters against the window pane, CRACKIN into the glass. The sound of the BLIZZARD creeps in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind POUNDS the river where Max had once been, but there' more thrashing in the water. Mixed in behind the falling snowflakes, BLACK SHAPES swirl and dive closer to the wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could feel the dead down there, just below my feet. Reaching up to welcome me as one of their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max breaks the surface - GASPING, STRUGGLING against the undertow. Not simply trying to breathe...trying to swim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an easy mistake to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly, the snow is gone. Just a bitter wind left in it place, whipping through desolate streets long after midni Shuffling up the littered sidewalk, three rough-looking M duck out of the wind by descending down to the subway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the dark side of the street, a pair of BOOTS follows t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A filthy platform, empty except for the three Men huddled a bench. A squeaking TURNSTILE catches their ear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same boots grind towards the Men. We don't see the walker's face, distracted by something else: a gleaming g wristwatch. As if to make certain the Men notice, he pull back his sleeve to check the time. Quarter past three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The watch glints as it passes into a dark doorway marked `MEN'S.' The Men follow, exchanging wicked grins. Too eas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Men slink into the bathroom, smirking at their oblivi prey at the sink. Steam rising, he sets the watch on the edge of the sink before washing his hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's a really nice watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. One of the Men LOCKS the door.       At the so the lock SNAPPING, he raises his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max Payne, but not yet the man struggling for life in the river: clean-shaven, skin like bleached bone. Haunted eye In the murky mirror, Max sees the Men circling closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (drooling over the watch) Kinda reminds me of one I lost--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't lose it. You pawned it up on 128th a few hours ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max shuts off the water and calmly turns to face them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding to Man #2) Ask Doug. He was there with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug frowns, deeply confused about being called by his na

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been following us all night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (pointing) I'm only following you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While Doug digests that, PAWNSHOP pulls a pistol and trai it on Max's forehead. The third man - not much more than KID, visibly frightened - backs towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a cop, or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad. (to Doug) Go get my watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distractedly eyeballing Max, Doug brushes the watch off o the sink. It hits the dirty tile, delicate crystal CRACKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a sudden blur of movement, Max has one hand on the pis the other one SMASHING into Pawnshop's windpipe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug steps forward to help... BOOM! The pistol goes off a Max pries it free. Max looks up at Doug. Nowhere to run, races into the farthest stall and SLAMS the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the same instant, the Kid bolts for the door. Max has pick: follow or stay with the man he's tracking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the stall, Doug crawls on his stomach across the stick floor, trying to squeeze under the divider. Max raises th pistol and BLASTS a hole through the door of the next sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (craving, eyes closed) Watch over me, watch over me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The newly-perforated door flies open. Handcuffs SNAP, restraining a WHIMPERING Doug to the toilet pipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open your eyes, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug finds himself staring at the pistol's front sight. M reaches into his pocket and produces a tattered photograp It's the woman from Max's golden vision in the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever seen her before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug shakes his head violently, confusion and terror risi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got busted robbing a house in New Jersey with William Preston three--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm talking to you. (moving the photo closer) Did he ever say anything about this woman? Did you ever hear anyone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill died because their wings couldn't lift him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he got shot robbing a liquor store. What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incoherent, rambling) Their wings are golden, the feathers only look black...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sighing, Max unlocks Doug from the pipe, hauling him up a slamming into the wall as he cuffs his hands behind his b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stalks out of the bathroom, pushing Doug ahead of him Down on the tracks, the Kid shrinks into the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kid runs down the dark tracks, nervously glancing bac the receding light of the platform.   He slows gradually, relaxing as escape seems certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down to a walk, he startles at movement in the tunnel ahe FLAPPING WINGS - a bird, lost and trapped underground?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kid freezes, his frightened BREATHS almost enough to drown the sound out. It grows, though, more WINGS joining

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to retreat up the tracks, but the WINGS suddenly seem to be echoing towards him from all directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicked, the Kid becomes disoriented in the growing RACK the tunnel ahead begins to glow brighter as he spins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visible now in the growing light, BLACK SHAPES flicker ab the tracks - dozens becoming hundreds, swelling larger, t POUNDING wings joined by a train RUMBLING closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frozen, the Kid can only squint into the headlights closi in, petrified by the dark wings SWIRLING around him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front room of the cold case department is a mess - de piled high with paperwork and a week's worth of coffee cu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halfway in the front door, a young DETECTIVE stands holdi box of his belongings. He looks around for signs of life. SERGEANT ADAMS wanders down the hall, frowning at the dra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You my new guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't think anybody was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody's usually a little late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sgt. Adams leads the detective down a hall, giving the to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the cold investigations in the city are collected and delivered over to us. We call each witness to see if they can add anything to their original statement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if they can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We send the file back to the original precinct for follow-up. Don't get your hopes up, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sergeant continues towards the center of the building farther from the light of the windows. He stops at a door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you've gone through the file and come up empty, bring it here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter a windowless cave, long rows of metal cabinets stretching on forever into the heart of the building. At desk in the corner, Max slumps over a stack of files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max here handles our filing. Once it hits his desk, a case is officially dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax looks up, dark circles from his long night in the subw He nods, but the Detective is too busy making a note to s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if there's no phone number for a witness? Should I follow up in person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope, we don't do that down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: iscretely, Max slides his cut-up knuckles under the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand, then how--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you solve that unsolvable murder mystery and redeem yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grand jury couldn't find--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. Trust me, there's a tragic story behind why I'm here giving you this tour. We all did something, so just save it. (moving for the door) Follow me to the break room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detective turns to Max, embarrassed after his reprima

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should get a beer after work, or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max smiles and nods, but his eyes give him away as a liar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Maybe so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detective steals a look at Max as Adams shuts his doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naturally, this reaction piques the detective's curiosity

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R emember when you were a kid, and you'd hold your breath when you went past a graveyard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective nods.     Adams glances through the window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ust...try to leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sneaks a sideways glance to the door, watching Adams the new Detective away. Once they're gone, Max reaches in his desk and removes a file... `PRESTON, WILLIAM A.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax goes to a rusted cabinet and buries the file deep insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lock POPS.     Max steps inside, only silence to greet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max lays his jacket across the back of a worn leather cha footsteps REVERBERATING because there's little other furniture to absorb the sound. He keeps walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...past a table with one chair, past gleaming counters. M fills a glass of water from the tap. Eyes blank, patient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carefully, Max rests the full glass on the arm of the cha Reaching underneath the chair, Max produces an artist's sketchbook and places it delicately on the table before h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sith trembling hands, Max turns back the battered cover.. uddenly, colors burst into the monochrome room: bright swirls of oil pastels sketch out a still life in Technico

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gradually, Max's eyes lose their hardness. His breaths co FASTER, ragged. Jaw clenched, he turns the page...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More flowing brush strokes, the artist's feminine initial Max reaches up to turn the page, hands shaking severely..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes hold of the corner of the page, but his muscles won't cooperate - as if the page ways more than Max can l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's skin flushes red...tears almost welling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then at once, Max slams the book shut and turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door swings open. Hanging inside, the battered coat w saw Max wear in the subway. A pistol on a hook by the doo Urban armor, scarred by countless nights of service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max dresses himself for battle, eyes returning to stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max climbs out of the subway into a neighborhood with a f in two worlds: the buildings are old and crumbling, but t shops inside are sleek and expensive. A jarring combinati

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: ax walks up the street, brushing past HOMELESS PEOPLE and FASHIONISTAS jostling for the same space on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hallway is ancient brick, but the doors are pristine steel. Pausing at one with a dozen locks, Max KNOCKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door cracks.    An EYE appears.   Squinting, evaluati

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't come here anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William Preston was a dead end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door cracks enough to reveal the speaker: TREVOR, ski fat in an sharp suit and sunglasses, shirt open a little

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't come here, I said. I'm done helping you. I've already... (lowering his voice) ...paid my debt to society, you know? I've cooperated enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk.   Won't take long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max follows Trevor inside. The narrow brick entry opens i a cutting-edge loft beyond, filled with modern art and a gathering of BEAUTIFUL PEOPLE milling around enjoying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you found Bill's partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did, but Doug only wanted to talk about pigeons, or something. I need a new name, someone robbing houses to feed a habit around that same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three years is a lifetime for guys like that. One way or the other, they're probably all gone now. (a little self-satisfied) Either way, I'm not the one to ask anymore. I cater to a better class, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the guests catches Max's eye: NATASHA, young and beautiful, returns his gaze for an extra moment and smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a party. These are my friends. You remember friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need another name, or I start frisking your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trevor stands his ground, not flinching at Max's threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: don't have one to give you, Max. Look, you've gone through all your living leads, now you're running out of dead ones... (beat) I don't think this guy's out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max nods, fatigue fighting the determination in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ry sleeping at night every now and then, you'd see that for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max doesn't answer. His eyes have drifted back to Natasha She plucks a drink from a passing tray, revealing a dark smudge across the inside of her wrist as she does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd invite you in, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly intent, Max pushes past Trevor and into the loft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max weaves through the party towards Natasha, out of plac his utilitarian clothes. She looks up as he gets closer..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ou decided to stay for a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She speaks with a Russian accent - smiling, a little nerv Rather than answering, Max's eyes drop to her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ow it's your turn to say something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax takes her hand, gently turning it to reveal her tattoo black wing, stylized feathers tracing faint blue veins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's interesting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. It's... (glancing past Max) Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max follows her gaze to the front door, where Trevor is nervously greeting another new arrival: MONA SAX. She's striking, beautiful but also a little frightening. It doesn't hurt that she's flanked by BODYGUARDS. Russian Mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seeing Natasha standing with Max, Mona barrels across the room towards them. People stand aside to let her pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ithout preamble, Mona begins YELLING at Natasha in Russia Natasha RESPONDS in kind, clearly intimidated by Mona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly, Mona grabs Natasha's arm, jerking her off balan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you let go--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in perfect English) Mind your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona returns to Natasha, dragging her towards the door. Natasha's tone becomes PLEADING, physically no match for Mona. Max steps in, reaching up to touch Mona's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: t happens in a flash: Mona spins and takes hold of Max's arm. Incredibly, he's just as fast, slipping free of the grip that would surely have snapped his wrist...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, Max and Mona stare each other down. Surpris reevaluating each other. Natasha continues to TALK, her Russian anxious as Mona's bodyguards push through the cro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona's eyes drop to Max's chest, where the tussle pulled coat open to reveal a low-pro holster and tarnished badge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the flick of her wrist, Mona stops her guards' advan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd begins to notice the altercation. Natasha keeps TALKING, trying desperately to make peace and reassure Mo of something. Mona's eyes cut between Natasha and Max...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: till apprehensive, Mona shakes her head and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister. (beat) Sort of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Max nods at the understatement, Trevor rushes over, forcing a broad smile to reassure his guests. He pulls Ma coat closed over the badge and ushers him towards the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to go. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling free) Fine. I just want to ask her something first...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max turns to the spot where Natasha had been.   She's gon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party has grown more crowded. Max fights his way down dark hall, searching the shadowed faces he passes. Back here, the music is nothing but GROWLING BASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flickering glow escapes the gaps around one door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ring of candles in the center of the floor provides the only light. It's not enough to really see the PEOPLE insi We hear them CHANTING, low voices MURMURING in unison...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick glimpses in the candle light, bare flesh writhing. Cast on the walls, corresponding shadows twist and shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black feather billows across the floor between candles. Spreading up the wall, a new shadow rises above the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pair of wings - long and distorted in the candle light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max appears in the doorway as the shadows loose their sha Max only catching a glimpse, not sure what he's seeing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Max strains to see detail in the dark room, a face materializes in the haze: cheeks laced with tattoos, eyes twinkling flames sunk in deep shadow. JACK LUPINO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: uddenly, Max turns and sees Natasha standing beside him. immediately notice something different about her: staring boldly into Max's eyes, all her earlier shyness vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natasha glances through the door at the shifting shadows, smiling at what she sees. Max follows her eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging, coy) Take me somewhere, I'll tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max leads Natasha inside. Before he can even shut the doo Natasha pounces - kissing, hands running over his body. A he pushes back, Natasha's hands slip into Max's pockets..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly, Natasha breaks away and looks around the apartm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just move in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really interested, Natasha walks deeper into the room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hree years ago. So we're somewhere, now: who was that guy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In response, Natasha unbuckles her pants and lets them dr Still walking, opening her shirt on her way out of the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max moves down the hallway, following a trail of clothing From inside a room, we hear the faint sound of CHANTING..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Max's bed, a thin sheet barely covers Natasha's body. lips tremble with a slurred SONG. With predatory eyes, sh watches Max stop in the doorway, something holding him ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frustrated sigh) Fine. What was her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl from the boring story you want tell me. The one that ends with you living here. Very sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught off guard, Max tries to figure out how much he'll Natasha resumes CHANTING as she waits - a stream of frant SYLLABLES rattling off, nothing recognizable as words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tell you what... (beat, evil smile) Call me by her name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natasha grins, legs spreading, sheet starting to fall awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That way you can make love to her again, just like she never left you. (shrill, mocking voice) Oh, Max, I miss you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a switch, Max's face closes off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exhausted, to himself) There's nothing you can tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natasha explodes out of the bed, springing up naked in fr of Max - shoulders heaving with rage, eyes wild black hol

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ou're kicking me out of your bed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, it seems like Natasha is about to attack. physically intimidated, Max stares at her in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natasha stomps into the hall, gathering her clothes. She pulls a cell phone from her crumpled pants and dials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Owen, pick up if you're awake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max watches her disappear down the hall, front door SLAMM a moment later. He looks around, silence returning again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natasha walks down a dark, desolate block, the sound of h HEELS echoing off of the crumbling buildings around her. eyes are still wild, her stride quick and aggressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of MEN huddle in a stairway to avoid the wind. As Natasha passes, they look up at her with equally wild eye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: atasha steps off the sidewalk and into an alley, plunging into the darkness like she's been there many times before In the distance, faint MUSIC rumbles through the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moment later, the few working lamps on the street dim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natasha barrels down the alley, squinting to see ahead. music is a little louder, BASS shaking the dumpsters.

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: wind picks up, garbage blowing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly unsettled by something, Natasha's pace slows. tenses, all her swagger vanishing before our eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: can RATTLES in the alley behind her.    Natasha spins...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing - just the FLICKERING of moths swarming the alley only light, their shadows black shapes against the bricks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of much larger BEATING WINGS fills the alley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes wide with terror, Natasha searches for something in shapes cast by the moths, dread deepening as she finds it

dialogues.text: `GREEN, OWEN A.'       Not a mug shot, but a military ID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out in the hall, the crowd of detectives seems to grow larger, the POUNDING on the door becoming more severe.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: he SLAMMING sounds outside push Max deeper into the desk, frantically spilling the contents onto the floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another photograph of Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking, Max's hands dig deeper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An impact sends CRACKS splitting up the length of the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two detectives throw their shoulders into the door. The r crowd around them, foaming at the mouth to get inside to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more lunge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door SHATTERS, sending the detectives tumbling inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Photos and documents are scattered across the floor, over Alex's desk, mixed in with the fragments of the broken de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From an open window, the storm's first flurries drift ins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snowfall has picked up, flurries giving way to thick heavy flakes already sticking to the sidewalk. Max leans into the stinging wind, lost in the night's revelations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hax slows abruptly, looking back at the street behind him eavy shadows pool around the alleys, doorways and swellin cars. The streetlights seem to carry less in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIGURE walks down the opposite sidewalk. With heavy sno filling the space between them, it's hard to make out muc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but there's something flowing out from the figure's ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max turns back to the sidewalk ahead, jaw clenching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly, Max's ducks into the mouth of alley. Back press to the cold brick, he draws his pistol and CHAMBERS a rou Unseen by Max, something moves in the shadows behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he street lamps begin to sputter. In the strobing light, long black shadows billow from the Figure's shoulders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max backs away from the corner, deeper into the dark alle where three SHAPES are surging forward to meet him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max dodges, but his pistol's KNOCKED to the pavement. Max stumbles, bringing up his guard. The Man charges again. M sidesteps, grabbing an arm as he does, SNAPPING the bone.

dialogues.speaker: O
dialogues.text: ut on the street, the Man's SCREAMS mix with the howling wind. The Figure steps into the street, towards the alley

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is jumped from all sides, opponents finally coordinat to overwhelm him. The Figure steps out of the wind...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and what seemed to be wings turns out to be a long coa Mona Sax moves closer, opening that coat to reveal a thic metal chain. Max GROWLS as arms pull him upright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lose your dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona whips the chain into Max's face, CLANKING as it stri bone. Instantly, blood begins streaming from his mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk about my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chain CRACKS again, Max's teeth rattling from the blo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hoever killed your sister did the same thing to my partner-- (louder) It was the same person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona HITS Max again, this time in the shins.    Max CRIES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: slurred) So stupid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly at first, Mona WHIRLS the chain into a larger loop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You left your wallet lying beside her body. Who's stupid?

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: ax slumps to the side, spitting out a stream of blood...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that sound like something a Homicide cop would get wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona whips the chain faster, CUTTING the air...thinking.. Gasping at the pain, Max slowly straightens up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know somebody named Owen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona lets the chain's speed gradually slow again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen Green?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natasha called him on her way out of my apartment. Give me one day to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona drops the chain with a CLANK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She motions for her men to haul Max to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona and Max storm down a dim apartment hallway in tense silence. Max wipes the blood from the cuts on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona lets her coat fall open, revealing a machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody my sister used to hang around with. Nice kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chambering a round) You better hope he backs your story up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have things I need to ask him, myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona flashes Max a look before POUNDING on a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling through the door) Owen, open up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A louder, longer KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A muted SCREAM filters through the door, cutting her shor Max DRIVES his boot into the door, splintering the jam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Mona rush into the room, breath smoking from the cold. All of the windows are open. Gusts of snow blow inside, drifts of white powder extending into the room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Owen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He SCREAMS his response from the next room.    They rush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...through the door, weapons drawn.    Both stop short:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OWEN GREEN is all alone in the room. SCREAMING, swatting empty air around him, each limb moving a different direct

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: ax lowers his pistol - ready for anything, not for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen's feet slip over the snow, toes curling desperately the ice, searching for traction as they slide closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (breathless, to no one) Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...to an open window on the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't seem to hear - sweat streams down his terrifie face, snowflakes frosting the perspiration on his chest. Owen's eyes are instead drawn through the open windows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..where SILHOUETTES flicker against the storm-darkened sk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oblivious to the shapes outside, Max and Mona watch Owen' terror intensify, his dervish dance growing more frantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside every window, BLACK SHAPES float closer in the ai above the street - vaguely human, long wings POUNDING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...sending gusts of wind ripping through the windows, kic up snow and ice. Max and Mona shrink back, shielding thei eyes at the blast as Owen's tortured SCREAMS fill the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twisting like he's trying to pull free from invisible han Owen reaches the window. As if trying to push back, his hands and feet fly up to the trim around the window...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen, wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to turn around, Owen's eyes find the reflected ima of Max and Mona in the window he's being pulled to...

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: is attention is torn from their reflections on top of the glass by the spectres looming beyond it outside. Their cl reach in, raking his body, pulling him closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realizing that Owen isn't stopping, Max rushes towards hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Make them stop, tell them I can't fly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max lunges forward, trying in vain to cover yards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...when Owen only has inches.    He's ripped into the voi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max throws himself forward into the window, looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where Owen falls, looking up at Max helplessly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... then less terrified, as the wind keeps RUSHING past..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and then, just before impact, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owen CRASHES into the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona races up to join Max in the window. For a stunned be they look down at the shattered body of Owen Green - his unblinking eyes frozen on the heavens, collecting snowfla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaken) What did we just see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer, Max studies Owen's twisted body. Long, finger- like bruises trace out from his neck, blending with the tattoos that lace his grey skin. Grinning skulls, the USM eagle/globe/anchor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and a pair of wings, just like Natasha's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max drops a Polaroid of Owen's tattoo onto a glass counte

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lue water ripples through translucent pipes in the walls floor, the air of the small room glowing like the ocean. mirrored ceiling repeats the tattoo parlor again above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure this is the place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Natasha had all her work done here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elderly TATTOO ARTIST moves up behind the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something I can help you with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max slides the photograph across to the Tattoo Artist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I wanted this tattoo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're probably in the Marine Corps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the wings) This one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Artist stoops closer, tensing when he sees the design Mona leans over the counter, locking onto the Artist's ey

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As encouragement, Mona lets her coat open to reveal her g

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intimidated) It's a Norse superstition. The Vikings used to wear them for protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, my sister had all the guardian angels she needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not angels. Valkyries.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: he Artist goes to a shelf bulging with old books - his reference library. He searches through dusty volumes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just past the shelves, a doorway is cracked open. A young APPRENTICE artist hovers in the dark and listens in on th conversation unnoticed - sweating, his pupils drawing bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Returning with a book, the Artist finds the page: a winge woman led by a pack of wolves over a grizzly battlefield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Norse mythology, the only way you get to go to heaven is to die in violence. Die in your sleep, you go to hell. Valkyries fly over the battlefields, picking out the righteous dead. They reward the people who draw first blood. (beat) A soldier's angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nodding, Mona lets her gun drift away from the Artist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm generally thrilled to have referral business, but I tell people looking for those wings to find ink closer to home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some club down in Alphabet City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona turns to leave, satisfied, but Max is stuck on the b the valkyrie's empty eyes, bloody bodies at her feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protection from what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, all the lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: he pipes stop glowing, blackness replacing the blue light

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the corner of his eye, Max sees a DARKER SHADOW ra across the room towards them, almost too fast to be human

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Mona have time to duck; the Artist isn't so lucky CRACK of bone, the old man's skull taking the brutal forc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona's weapon BARKS, a short burst RIPPING through the ai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: n the momentary fire, Max can see the Shape swinging a cl The bat CUTS through the air, SMASHING open glass pipes i the wall behind Max, the shards raining down over him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Figure charges at Max again.   Max's pistol CRACKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is abruptly silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights flash on.   Mona steps out of the back room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is stunned to find himself standing over nothing more monstrous than the Apprentice - one hand over the hole in chest, the other weakly swinging a shard of glass at Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gurgling, to Max) They see you...they see you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max shakes his head, struck mute by the look in the dying man's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max pushes the car over slick streets, clothes covered in Artist's blood. Lost in thought, Mona looks out the windo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (without conviction) Maybe it isn't anything new.   People get strung out, act crazy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they were both on something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crystal meth, maybe, some amphetamine that raises your body temperature in an overdose. Explains why they were both sweating like that, trying to cool off. (beat) Of course, a junky won't usually jump out the window if there's someone left in the room to beg or rob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax nods his agreement, replaying Owen's death in his mind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were standing right beside me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jumped is not the word I'd use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a block of abandoned storefronts, only one retains a s of life, its red sign burning in the dying light: RAGNA R

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: he streets are more crowded there, people shuffling towar that sign and the sounds of DARK MUSIC filtering from ins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's car turns onto the block, slowly approaching Ragna Max and Mona silently absorb the scene on the street. Eve from halfway down the block, BASS from the club reaches t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the street, Max watches someone dragging a limp bo by one leg. Nobody he walks past seems to notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Owen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max keeps his speed slow, idling away up the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't anything I've seen before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ragna Rok recedes in the mirror, the block between it and car studded with more smoldering cars and dead-eye faces, their numbers seeming to grow even as Mona watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever been to Rome?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max doesn't answer, the coming plague before him register Mona glances up at a passing street sign - "LITTLE ITALY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better cities than this one have fallen. (pointing to the curb) This is far enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona opens her car door and climbs out, leaning back insi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about the chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona SLAMS the door and moves off down the sidewalk, blen into the crowd. Max drops the car into gear, giving one l glance to Ragna Rok before pulling away.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: here's some flicker of movement on the rooftop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: p on the roof, MUSIC inside the club RATTLES old pipes. Perched at the edge of the roof, a figure CHANTS along...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Lupino - the tattooed face we caught   a glimpse of candle light of Trevor's party, now fully   visible in th failing sun and no less frightening. His    colorless eye absorb the street, the SCREAMS, Max's car   pulling away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his back, the tattoos of two elaborate black wings. St rises from ink-blackened skin, snow melting before it lan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sits in his chair in the silent room, turning the pag of Michelle's book. There's more than grief on his cut an bruised face tonight, hands not trembling the way they we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fruit bowls, delicate charcoal nudes flip past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frustrated, Max lets the images drift by with less sentim images no longer speaking to the questions he needs answe With an exasperated sigh, Max slams the book closed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faint white sliver appears in the cover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max leans closer. It's the corner of a piece of paper, protruding from a razor-thin cut in the spine of the sketchbook, invisible under all but the closest inspectio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max runs his thumbnail into the gap, spreading glue CRACK - he flinches, almost afraid to cause the book pain.

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: or a moment, Max is caught between his desire to protect memento and to see what's hidden inside. A deep breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a sharp pull, the cover of the book SHEARS away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pages wad and wrinkle, old paint flaking off. The cov he'd caressed RIPS. Fluttering to the floor, a sheaf of yellowed pages hidden in the cover flutter to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max opens the folded pages. The first is nearly identical what we saw inside: a bouquet of flowers, unfinished. Max scrutinizes the pencil strokes...suddenly, his eyes go wi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little pair of bat-like wings. In the corner of the pag having nothing to do with the rest of the still life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max turns to the next page. There's a another drawing of wings - larger this time, pencil strokes more energetic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horrified by what he's seeing, Max's hands tremble as the turn the page. On the next, the wings are the main drawin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the next, they're scrawled in smeared ink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nauseous, to himself) No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wings begin to lose their shape, overlapping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Growing together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last page is completely black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even with everybody out of uniform, the builds and body language mark this as a cop bar. BB rushes inside, hair giving him away as having been asleep shortly before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he bar is still decorated with plastic mistletoe and fake snow. BB looks at the BARTENDER, who motions to the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BB fights his way to a corner booth, where Max is slumped over a beer and a shot. A matching set wait for BB across the table. BB pulls off his coat and sits, forced casual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was sitting at this very table that your father told me I needed to retire. (beat) For about a minute, I just sat here thinking about knocking him out of his chair. The job was everything to me, to the point that I couldn't see the writing on the wall - what it was doing to my marriage, my health. Your old man knew if I was going to listen to reason, it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B            could only happen in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B stoops down to find Max's eyes, trying for a connection

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing you can't say in here. It's like hallowed ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a long beat, Max works up the nerve to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched a guy throw himself out of a window tonight. The things he was saying-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any guy who throws himself out a window, I wouldn't pay any attention to the things he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The problem is, I knew what he was talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BB tries to nod his understanding, but concern creeps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't been really afraid of anything since...that night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something going on, and I can't find a rational explanation for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's...something out there, hurting people--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's real.     I'm not crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then stop acting like it. Max, you're breaking into offices, I.A. is all over you, you won't even show up for work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night Alex died, there was something else in the room with us. I saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B goes a bit pale, smile fading as Max's words continue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really important that you be careful how you talk to people about this, okay? You're already under suspicion--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same thing these people are seeing right before they die. (beat, pained) I think Michelle saw it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For God's sake, don't drag her into this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax stands up, storming towards the exit. BB pulls out a thick money clip and overpays before following...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BB rushes out, struggling to keep up with Max's longer le

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's really going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex found something out about what happened to her. Something new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way.    He would have told us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was trying, right before he died...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, okay? Why don't you come back with me, let Beth make up the guest room for you. Just for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max nods, but keeps moving away from BB.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to take some time. Get some sleep, heal up. See if it still feels real after that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max crosses against the light, cutting through the drivin snow. BB tries to follow, but traffic pushes him back.

dialogues.speaker: H
dialogues.text: elpless, BB can only bury his hands in his pockets and wa Max fade away. After a moment, he pulls something out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A business card: `J. BRAVURA, I.A.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a ticket booth, an elderly ATTENDANT shivers by a spac heater, ticket windows plugged with make-shift insulation

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attendant looks up from his book and sees Max approac through the snow. Max slows as he gets closer, looking up the glowing threshold to the trains beyond. He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (via intercom) You riding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max holds for a moment. For all the danger he's faced, th is the most hesitation we've seen from him so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: via intercom) If you're coming, you better come on. Way it's looking, might be the last train tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max takes a step into the light of the ticket booth. The attendant opens the ticket slot, letting a gust of freezi air blow inside. Max slides a few bills through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ticket in hand, Max starts his solitary march to the trai

dialogues.speaker: A
dialogues.text: dingy, dark bar on the first floor of an even sleazier hotel. It's nearly empty, only the dedicated DRUNKS venturing out in the storm. The front door swings open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The old men shiver at the stiff blast of wind rushing in, turning to look. Napkins flutter. Snowflakes blow inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a booth in the corner, VINNIE GOGNITTI (50s, pudgy) shoots a hard look at the open door, not immediately recognizing the SILHOUETTE in the passage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In or out, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona steps inside, boots heavy with ice. Her MEN follow. Flanked by MEN of his own, Vinnie freezes when he sees Mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk. (beat) Talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gradually, Vinnie and his men relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the door, then. You Ruskies may be used to it, but I'm freezing my dick off over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've packed into a tiny back office - Russian gunmen o one side of the desk, Italians on the other. Mona and Vin represent their different sides, the only people seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.     So talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something was taken from me. It involves a club in Italian territory, so I need your blessing to go make it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're asking my permission? smirking to his men) Well in that case, sweetheart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona looks Vinnie over, bored to death by the whole thing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said `blessing.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Well, blessing might cost extra. Which club are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ragna Rok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: innie tries to keep a poker face, but the name chills him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over on Avenue--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. (beat, rattled) Sure, fine. You have my permission...blessing, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona frowns, her wishes granted a little too easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do still control that block, right? It's south of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's name is Jack Lupino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that sounds Italian to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's no kind of Italian I've ever seen. Tattooed freak, a real sicko from what we hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sneering) You're afraid of tattoos, now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the club first opened, I sent somebody down to collect the...you know, fire insurance. A day goes by, and I don't see him. Then I get two boxes delivered to me. One box's got my guy's hands and ears in it. The other box has a quarter of a million dollars in cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This neighborhood has been your family's forever. Two-fifty large is all it takes to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What got my attention, Mona, was that the boxes were delivered by a cop car. A guy in uniform hands them to me in broad daylight. (beat) I'm not scared of tattoos, or freaks, or mouthy Russian bitches. But whoever's watching over Lupino, whoever it is you really need to bless you walking inside Ragna Rok...him, I am scared of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The platform is cleaner than the ones in the city - dress up for the tastes of the COMMUTERS who step off of the tr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max threads his way through the handful of exhausted BUSINESSMEN arriving home, moving out into the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow's driving just as hard out here, but peaceful ho with warm windows glowing make the storm feel comforting. the yards, forgotten sleds disappear under new powder, go for good by morning. Snowmen distort as they swell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max Payne trudges up the center of the street, a black st spoiling the peace of the evening. A trespasser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One house on the block stands out: there's no neatly shov driveway, no colorful Christmas lights flashing from the eaves. A black void behind every window, no life inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax stands in the street, looking up at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was thirty-five. The daughter, two months. From what we could tell, it started out as a robbery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of footprints lead around back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oth of the men had records, mostly bullshit - possession, petty theft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hanging in the overgrown hedges, an overlooked scrap of yellow police tape shimmers in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ut that day...I don't know. They had something else on their minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stands at the back door. He touches the unpainted woo around the glass, repairs never fully complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax was maybe ten minutes late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max reaches for the handle...hesitant to actually touch..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A living room in the stillness of evening, golden air pac like amber around baby bottles and toys on the coffee tab The front door opens, and a man steps inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max Payne, different in every way: the malnourishment and neglect gone from his face, a fullness in his frame from

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: regular home-cooked meals. Shave and a haircut. Nice suit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax picks up the mail from the floor and strolls inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tie loosened, Max gets a beer from the fridge. Unwinding, takes a long sip and begins sorting through the mail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lancing up from the mail, Max sees the kitchen door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass smashed.    Blinds torn.   Standing open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max charges upstairs.    MEN'S VOICES echo down from abov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Michelle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes aren't hard yet. Rushing up the stairs, we see Max's faith in the world start to crack for the first tim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max turns the corner into a hallway bathed in golden afternoon light, the same one he saw in the river...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between Max and the end of the hall, two JUNKIES are hudd against a door. Twisting the handle, SMACKING the wood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max pulls a pistol from a low-pro holster, stepping forwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Michelle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Junkies turn to Max, eyes black and glassy.    Sick s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: shouting to the door) Michelle, I'm right here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a word, the Junkies charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max takes aim and BLASTS one of them in the forehead. The

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: other keeps rushing, swinging a long knife at Max's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax ducks, a quarter-second and a quarter-inch from a slit throat. The swing throws the thin man off balance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries again - ropy muscles straining skin speckled wit tracks. Max grabs his arm, throwing the thin man off balance. They go down to the hardwood floor together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too close to line up a shot, Max drives the butt of the pistol into the man's nose, SPLITTING it across the bridg Blood spatters his gaunt face, but those eyes never chang

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.     They're angels, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straining, he moves the knife's tip closer to Max's belly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max jams the barrel under the Junkie's leering jaw and PU THE TRIGGER. Blood atomizes into a hanging cloud around h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max jumps up and races to the door.    Locked from the in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling, frantic) Michelle!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max throws his shoulder into the door, SNAPPING the hinge

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The momentum sends Max tumbling inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN slips out of the window, one leg still inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax OPENS FIRE at the retreating shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtains billow in front of the open window, a summer sun outside. Max lets the gun fall to his side, breathing har

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: ichelle huddles on the bed, baby wrapped tight in her arm Max rushes over to her, reaching out to touch her shoulde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her mouth is wide open, eyes unfocused.    Muscles slack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle's not stunned.    She's not unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he baby isn't just sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment that hits him, the lights go out of Max's eyes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stands at the door, seeing the room with those same e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The furniture is gone, all the carpet ripped out. One win is still open, no frilly curtains blocking the blackness outside. Snow gusts in, piling on the sill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We looked everywhere for the third guy, but there was nothing to go on. Not a hair of him left behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly marching across the room, Max SLAMS the window shu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BB stands in the window, watching the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I called in a favor before I retired, had him transferred to Cold Case while he dealt with the shock of it. I thought it we were patient, gave him time, Max would come back to his old self again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura sits in front of the desk, watching BB. When BB finally looks over, the weight of the story showing in hi eyes, Bravura's face B doesn't reveal any hint of emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I called you because I thought I recognized something in you. I thought if we could talk off the record--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotional) This isn't just some job stress freak- out. This is a man who lost everything, and who deserves a little understanding from the rest of us. If you'd known him before... (beat, pained) You'd want to believe him, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe him about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not expecting this turn in the conversation, Bravura sits

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you saying you think Max did have something to do with Alex's murder?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not. Alex was his partner, they were like brothers...he couldn't have. There's no way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what are we talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Max is like a son to me. Don't put me in a position to have to hang him. (beat, pained) But you should hear the kinds of things he's saying...hallucinations, none of it makes any sense to me. I'm worried he's going to get into another situation before I can convince him to come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling me he was--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you to find him tonight, before somebody else gets hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura nods, reeling from the revelation of this new information. BB picks up his coat and starts for the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there anything we can do to help you bring him in? Unofficially, of course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bringing him in won't be a problem. Where I need your help will be his--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you say that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura stands, finishing a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A New Jersey unit ID'd him near his old house. It shouldn't be long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B nods, somberly mulling this over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to find him first, protect him. Some of the guys from Alex's unit beat you to him, they won't wait for a trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the edge of a strip mall, a ramshackle personal storag business sits behind a razor-wire fence. Inside the fence rows of stalls for rent, covered by metal garage doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: here's the faint sound of METAL STRETCHING, and Max is ov the fence. He moves through the rows, reading the numbers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A padlock hangs from the door, shining metal glazed over a sheet of ice. Max finds a pristine key on a ring in his pocket. Hands shaking, he cracks the ice and tries...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garage door raises, cold metal RATTLING as it rolls u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stands silhouetted in the doorway, looking in on ragg stacks of cardboard boxes. His breath blooming around him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max steps inside, pulling a box marked `GARAGE' out into light. Opening it, he roots around and finds a flashlight Switched on, a golden beam cuts through the blue shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max walks deeper into the space, brushing the light over boxes. He holds his hand over one, as if warming it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max opens the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: aiting for him under the flaps, a stuffed animal stares u at Max from inside the box. Silly grin, frozen eyes shini

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands trembling, Max pushes the toy aside. Deeper in the box, he finds a framed picture and pulls it into the ligh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The photograph is of Max - younger, cleaner, genuinely smiling. Posed along with him, Olan Mills-style, are Elizabeth and the baby. Gauzy backdrop, church clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max studies it, haggard new face reflecting in the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly, Max jumps up and moves away from the box. Long strides, trying in vain to physically shake the memories, block out the emotions with something productive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The flashlight beam keeps sweeping, deeper and deeper. Ma chokes back tears, occasionally glancing at the baby box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he beam hits on a document box in the back row.   `OFFICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max rushes over, nearly tipping the other boxes in his hu to throw the lid off the document box. Rows of folders, a

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: neatly labeled with feminine script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax brushes his fingers over the tabs, smiling sadly.    E year numbered -- `1998,' `1999,' `2000'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Okay, Chelle. Help me, here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's fingers skim to the last file in the box, marked `2004.' Much thinner than the others. Her last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one file in the final section. Max opens it, finding pages of handwritten notes, photocopies, drawings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing the file, he checks the name on the tab and frown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max steps out of the storage locker. He tucks the manila folder inside his coat and pulls the metal door closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts away, retracing his steps to the fence. Mind reeling with what he's just seen, the memories flooding b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a second set of footprints in the snow before him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max freezes, their significance immediately registering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay where you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG COP steps out of the shadows behind Max, pistol trained on the back of his head. The cop's eyes are wide

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with panic. He assumes an awkward, textbook firing positi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning slowly) Relax, I'm a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move! I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he gun stays trained on Max.    Slowly, he raises his han

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just relax. I need you to trust me for a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? Is that what you said to your partner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing with the gun) Lay down on your face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max studies the cop - stiff legs unsteady on the deep sno his frostbitten fingers wrapped around the trigger. Trapp between two rows of locked doors, Max has no cover to run

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peeking through the snow at Max's feet, an extension cord snakes under the shivering cop's legs and down the corrid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bending down) Okay, just take it easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max starts to lay down, causally laying his hand over the power cord. The cop edges closer, smirking as Max complie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word's gotten around about the sick shit you did to him, too. If I were you, I'd get ready for sort of a long ride back into the city...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max wraps his hand around the cord and whips it tight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cop pitches backward, squeezing off a SHOT as he fall Before he can fire again, Max pounces on the cop, driving

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: knee into his chest and wrenching the pistol away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he cop twists in the extension cord, unplugging the light Max DRIVES the butt of the pistol into the side of his he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he cop goes limp. Max pulls the clip, clears the chamber and lets the gun fall in the snow beside the unconscious

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struggling to his feet, Max races down the corridor and scaling the icy chain link. He drops into the snow, immediately breaking into a dead run on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An express elevator HISSES upwards at great speed, the sl interior like a European sports car. Alone inside, Jason Colvin watches the blur of numbers with dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A muted CHIME, and the doors draw back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thin steel beams loft through the air, three stories of o air encased by glass, a silent void projected into the he of the storm. In the center of the room, a single black b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a desk, obsidian, polished to a mirrored sheen. Aesi International's cool blue logo reflects across its surfac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason Colvin approaches the desk, nervously watching the shadowed figure of Nicole Horne read through a document. Every hair, every stitch of clothing perfect.

dialogues.speaker: F
dialogues.text: ootsteps ECHOING, he reaches the desk and waits for a bea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: icole cuts her eyes to Colvin - withering, a current of f passing through him. With great effort, she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max slumps in his seat, watching the black sky whip past. The manila folder closed in his hands, fingers tracing th edges. Slowly, carefully, he lets the folder fall open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's eyes skim across the handwritten notes, lingering o underscored phrases and circled words. Drinking it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the next page, a sketch of black wings pulls Max's attention. With dread, he reads a note below the drawing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Subjects?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hypnotic motion of the train begins to change, the rh of the RAILS faltering a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax turns the page. More wings, each in a slightly differe style, each version surrounded by descriptive notes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max skims, excited, as the train's HICCUPS grow worse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the blue and black world sweeps past outside the windo Max's face softens almost into a smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the lights go out.    The train rapidly loses speed..

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: tartled voices MURMUR. Windows that had been black glow t life as the passengers' eyes adjust to the dark car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: utside, the moonless night becomes a hazy expanse of blue snow, covering the embankments along the railroad tracks the broken-down houses in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The darkness changes Max, too, hardening his face again. tucks the folder safely into his coat and zips it up tigh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the front of the car, the windows begin to fill with light. The door opens, a flashlight beam sweeps inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pistol between his knees, Max pulls the hammer back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An obese CONDUCTOR (40s) steps inside. Immediately, all o the other passengers begin to QUESTION HIM at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting over) Ladies and gentlemen, please remain calm. The storm's caused a power failure, but it's absolutely nothing to worry about. We'll be up and running again before long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Movement outside catches Max's eye. A FIGURE in the shado alongside the train. Gravel CRUNCHES. Voices WHISPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CONDUCTOR (cont'd) Our policy is to move everyone up to the front car until the lights come on again. It'll be a little warmer if we're all together...
