dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: ax splits his attention between the other passengers and window, watching for more movement outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the Figure breaks in the opposite direction - n attempt at quiet, a POUNDING run away from the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: onfused, Max straightens up.    The temperature has chang

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE MORE FIGURES, running in the opposite direction. from the train, up the snowy tracks it's yet to cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (recognizing) Get out of the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PASSENGERS fill the aisle. High school girls sneaking int the city... An old man going to work... Drunk yuppies in and green scarves, on their way back from a Holiday party

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Get out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An EXPLOSION rips through the front of the car and swells ball of fire smashing through the car and blowing it apar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Up and down the dark street, shadowed GHOULS break window and claw at abandoned cars, searching for anything of val

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving comfortably through the shadows, Mona follows the general movement towards a BASSY QUAKE farther up the blo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red neon `RAGNA ROK' bloodies the snow in the air, mark the entrance to the club responsible for the RUMBLE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, that music is EARSPLITTING - a jet engine at 200 beats per minute. Lights strobe past red gels, frozen glimpses of thin limbs and black pupils on the dance floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ona melts into a corner, inconspicuously watching the roo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: inding around the dance floor, CLUBGOERS - some ragged, s in nice clothes - queue at a metal door in the back wall. One after another, they wait for their moment to enter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a disturbance at the front door. Black-clad Guard force open a rift in the crowd on the dance floor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack Lupino walks inside the rift - his tattooed face red black, eyes calmly sweeping out across the riotous crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lupino moves through bodies roiling like a parted sea, sh walls of twisting flesh towering above him to the rafters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mixed within, the wings POUND and SWEEP, blotting the lig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BB crawls out from under the quilts, careful not to wake WIFE. He passes windows frosted with ice, on his way to..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BB shuffles down the hall, shivering in his boxers. He pauses at the thermostat, frowning to find the heat cut o

dialogues.speaker: B
dialogues.text: B turns, startling as Max steps out of the shadows - step stiff with pain, clothes dripping icy water across the fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) Max? What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max opens his coat and pulls out the file, now badly wrin and soggy. He opens it and hands BB a newspaper clipping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those grunts who went crazy in Iraq?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go a little further, read what they did to the bodies. It's the same as what happened to Alex and that girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BB reads on, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BB looks up, startled, as Max pages through Michelle's no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all in her notes: people describing fevers, hallucinations...their lymph nodes swell until their necks bruise like something's been choking them. (pointing to the drawings) The angels they all talk about? Michelle talks about eye spasms that make things seem to flutter. Mixed with the other delusions, that starts looking like wings... (beat) She wasn't seeing them. She was trying to figure out why other people were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thought she was working on allergy medicines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody at Aesir knows what--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thunderstruck) Oh, my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, BB turns to show Max the grief in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.    I killed Alex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He came to me about six months ago, asking about one of the executives at Aesir. At the time I had no reason to connect it to Michelle, I just thought... (beat, torn up) I tried to warn him, this guy has connections to some scary people--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?   What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BB hesitates, rattled by the rage in Max's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason Colvin. He used to be the head of the pharmaceutical division, but he's moved up over the last few years. (beat) I guess Michelle probably reported directly to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max barely nods, jaw clenched as he scoops up the documen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ou've got copies of this stuff, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking for a moment, Max sets the folder down again and turns away towards the dark hallway. BB picks up the fold

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: e careful, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max doesn't respond, storming off into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snow isn't deep near the charred and twisted metal of train, melted by the fireball. Police tape rings the area

dialogues.speaker: D
dialogues.text: ETECTIVES wander between yellow tarps in the train, sippi coffee. Out on the tracks, Bravura works alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like ten bodies, give or take. Even in New York, that ought to be enough to earn Payne the spike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blast point is outside the train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of the detectives want to encourage him by answering

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ased on the spread of the wreckage... they moving very fast, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He forced them to stop, first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura nods at the explanation, but without conviction. continues to scan the wreckage, still not satisfied...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he had the bomb with him inside, but he decided to walk outside to detonate it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking if that seems like odd behavior from a guy who cut his partner's head off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Young Cop from the storage building slips down the sn bank and towards Bravura. His face is bruised and swollen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanted to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful what you say to him, if you ever want to make detective...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Bravura, guarded) I already filled out a report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura sees the Young Cop aware of the detective's prese

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me where it happened, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura and the Young Cop stand on the spot where he foug Max the night before - disturbed snow, the frayed cord...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jumped out and wrapped that cord around me, and before I had a chance...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura nods at the bullshit, focus drawn to Max's locker

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing) He was coming out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the Young Cop nods, Bravura starts to step inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, real cops are working here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few CSI TECHS take photographs of Max's storage locker. Bravura walks through, eyes quickly scanning the distract jumble of boxes. The Homicide Cop follows, exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: t the back, Bravura stops and picks something up. It's th lid of the box, `OFFICE' written in Michelle's pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura looks around. There's no document box to match th lid. However, there are dust-free rectangles in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a CSI tech) Where's the stuff you guys moved?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's been moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you playing detective now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a mission, Bravura scans the rest of the room. He sees another open box, a colorful stuffed animal peeking out. Bravura opens it, startled by the family portrait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (studying the photo) This is his wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura finally looks up to see the Homicide cop smirking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: spent four hours up at Homicide going through Alex's desk and cataloging pictures of this woman, and not one of you bastards bothered to mention that she was Max Payne's wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging) If Alex was getting a little something on the side--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you protecting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura charges closer, carrying enough force that the mu larger Homicide Cop steps back. His cool facade crumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody, we just...why would anybody talk to IA without a reason?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (livid) You've got a reason, now. Tell me everything you know about this woman, starting with her name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city is starting to shut down under the relentless sn the sidewalks are nearly empty, only cabs on the icy stre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Aesir corporate offices gleam in the diffuse light, a pillar of glass and steel disappearing up into the storm.

dialogues.speaker: R
dialogues.text: Jason Colvin steps out of a cab and marches up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepping off of the elevator, Colvin passes a RECEPTIONIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go on home, already.   There's nothing going on today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there's someone in your office...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colvin steps through the doorway and stops short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stands behind Colvin's desk, inspecting the photograp hanging on the wall. He's cleaned himself up a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to a photo) This your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: N

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. Three years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For reasons Colvin can't fathom, Max's mood seems to dark even farther. Colvin sees the badge clipped to his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there something I can help you with, detective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell me about Project Valhalla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous laugh) I think you might have the wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barely keeping his poker face, Colvin eyes the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: eed to make a call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'd better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max motions for Colvin to go ahead. While the executive's shaking hands dial the number, Max closes and LOCKS the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, there's a detective here... to Max) What did you say your name was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abruptly, Max RIPS the phone cord out of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low) She was my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words, Max's flat delivery, catch Colvin like ice wat Still holding the dead receiver, Colvin staggers back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michelle Payne was my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What color there was to begin with drains out of Colvin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before you say anything else, I want you to know who I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max throws his elbow up, CRUSHING Colvin's nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura enters the soaring lobby of the Aesir building, stomping his shoes clean. He approaches the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flashing his badge) I need to talk to somebody about a woman who used to work here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colvin's eyes flutter open.   His nose is smashed flat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's being held upright by his belt, which loops around h neck and the headrest of his ergonomic chair. His wrists bound to the armrests with strips of his tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sits on the edge of the desk, heavy lamp in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly, eyeing the lamp) Please don't hit me again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max wraps the cord in his hand and jerks it free from the lamp, which he tosses with a CRASH. The cord, he keeps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week ago, I thought the universe had turned against me. Everything I loved was gone, and for some reason I'd been left here to suffer alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max strips back the insulation on the cord, exposing two frizzed bundles of wire: one brass, the other silver. Positive and negative. Colvin watches, apprehensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ut it wasn't the universe that took my family away from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max plugs in the cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He crouches by Colvin, wire in each hand, moving them clo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about Valhalla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colvin struggles to pull away from the approaching wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max brushes the bare wires against Colvin's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: here's a bright SPARK.       Colvin SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no Project Valhalla anymore.   I shut it down years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A timid KNOCKING starts on Colvin's door, VOICES calling Max waits for more, eyes frozen, wires hanging ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctant) It was a disaster. The drug was so addictive, the damage it did to the mind was so devastating that we lost our government funding. By the end, we couldn't even guarantee the safety of our scientists administering the experiment. Test subjects would follow them home and kill them for an extra dose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what happened to Michelle?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows what happened to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max picks up a cup of coffee from the desk and pours it o Colvin's face as he struggles more frantically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max brings the wires closer to Colvin's wet skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: terrified) People thought Michelle might be a whistle-blower. That she wasn't loyal enough to Aesir, and she might go public about the program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max's eyes thaw, hit by the first true words about her de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura sits in the lobby, impatiently skimming a magazin On the far side of the enormous room, movement draws his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line of black-clad SECURITY GUARDS swiftly moving in formation into a stairwell. SWAT precision, heavy hardwar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura springs up, approaching the Guards left at the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Authorized personnel only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura pulls out his badge, and plans to keep moving... But the guards don't immediately part. They look at each other, silently conferring. Bravura's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at him.    Move aside. (louder) I 'm authorized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max lets the wires fall away.   Solemnly, he draws his pi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you asking me about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already told you.    Be quiet, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max chambers a round, leaving his hand up to block the sp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why today? It's over, I got rid of everything before they moved me out of the division--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you haven't been Downtown lately, because you missed a spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colvin looks up, Max's words suddenly scarier than the gu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling me that there are people out there taking the drug again? urgent) How many of them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max shakes his head.    Colvin's eyes show real terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it, I knew something was going on. I told her the numbers were too good--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POUNDING outside the door is louder, more VOICES call

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling through the door) Mr. Colvin, are you okay in there? Security's on its way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max turns to the door - trapped, ready to fire on what co through. Colvin looks at Max, a sudden realization dawnin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not coming for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colvin begins to struggle harder than ever, but his fear isn't directed at the man with the gun standing over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only know my name because somebody high up decided to cut me loose. (gesturing) There's a safe in the wall. It's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: earing a trap, Max pushes aside a painting and pulls open the door. A small stack of DVDs sits inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show that to whoever will watch. If this thing spreads, nothing will keep the rest of you safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks at the middle manager, desire to pull the trigg slowly losing out to the credibility of Colvin's story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max unfastens the belt, using it to hoist Colvin to his f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) Wait, I'm not ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICE WORKERS draw back and GASP as Colvin's bloody face appears. Max is close behind, holding the belt around Colvin's neck, pressing his pistol to the back of his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back up, all of you.   Make a path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a disturbance at the back of the crowd - glimpses black uniforms fighting forward. The Guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max pivots, holding Colvin towards the Guards as a shield

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: calling to the guards) Stay back, or I'll--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRACK!    Colvin's head snaps back, blood spraying over M

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: he crowd goes crazy, SCREAMING and trampling each other.. More SHOTS ring out, ripping through Colvin as Max lets h lifeless body fall and hides his retreat in the scramble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guards chase after Max, slowed by the panicking crowd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exhausted, Bravura plods up steps to a landing. Suddenly, AUTOMATIC WEAPONS erupt nearby. He fumbles for a cell pho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Jim Bravura, IA. You need to tell the units responding to the Aesir call to come equipped for automatic-- (frowning) The Aesir building, nobody's called anything in yet? (beat) Hell yes, I'd like to report something. We've got machine gun fire in Midtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bravura snaps his phone shut, trying to regulate his brea Drawing a tiny service revolver he creeps to the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stumbles up the hall. He chances a look back at the black-clad GUARDS crashing through office workers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BURST of machine gun fire POUNDS the floor in front of Max's feet. More Guards seal off the hall ahead. Nowhere else to go, Max grips a cubicle wall and vaults over...

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: ax gets a few careful SHOTS off from his new elevation, dropping Guards who've lost sight of him as he jumps from desk to desk, working deeper into the maze of cubicles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fastest Guards race ahead to block off a burning `EXI sign. Max's boots THUNDER across desks, papers flying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guards ahead FIRE, but Max shows now sign of slowing. Overhead lights EXPLODE, smoke and sparks raining down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max launches himself into the air, pistol CRACKING as he falls. Bullets RIP through the retreating Guards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max hits the ground hard, scrambling through the exit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Put your hands up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max slides to a stop, startled to see Bravura aiming at h While he doesn't exactly comply, Max does lower the barre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (more human) You need to come in now, before anything else gets pinned on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax shakes his head.       HEAVY BOOT STEPS rumble closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was trying to stop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop what?     Tell me what's happening--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets STRAFE the wall just above Max's head. He dives t the ground, plaster dust and smoke pluming above him.

dialogues.speaker: W
dialogues.text: hile Max scrambles for cover, Bravura charges forward, waving his badge in the air above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NYPD!   Hold your fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: uards flow into the hall, a black mass bristling FIRE. It takes a split second for Bravura to realize they aren't stopping. He slips, tumbling back as bullets RIP past him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Hold your fire!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the machine guns go quiet. Smoldering gunpowder clouds the hallway. Bravura and the Guards search...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..but Max has disappeared into the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona struggles up a narrow street, buffeted by the wind. Ahead, flashing blue and red lights electrify the snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: squad car idles towards her, searchlight flashing into da shadows. Mona ducks her head away as the spotlight finds at her building door. For a moment, she's in a whiteout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lowly, the cop car moves on. Mona starts to use her key.. but the lock has already been forced open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona steps inside, ready for ambush.    She turns the cor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max sits on her couch, scraped and scorched from his esca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to the TV) You need to see this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over black, the Aesir corporate logo flashes up, quickly replaced by a simple block-letter title card:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the beginning of time, great generals have all wrestled with one undeniable truth - morale wins battles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ver an up-tempo ROCK SOUNDTRACK, a slick montage of war imagery: tanks roaring over sand dunes, missiles ripping through palace walls, American troops firing machine guns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear, fatigue, loss of focus...the future of combat medicine lies in the mind of the soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cutting-edge lab, SCIENTISTS working complex machinery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks to breakthroughs made by Aesir Pharmaceuticals, the military of tomorrow will be able of unlock the limitless potential inside every soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: n screen, the shot cuts to the interview of a YOUNG SOLDI in uniform. He smiles easily, confident, eyes alert but maybe a little distant. Something familiar about him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H         YOUNG SOLDIER (V.O.) ow has my experience in combat changed since being selected for Project Valhalla? (beat, smiling) I'm never scared, for starters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: uperimposed under his face: `PVT. JACK LUPINO.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: tartled, Mona moves closer to the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the one behind Ragna Rok. It's his club where the drug's being sold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You face down a group of insurgents and instead of fear, you're filled with...peace, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (2)      LUPINO(CONT'D) Like you're aware of the power you have in your own hands to make the world a better place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max studies Lupino's image - thinner, no visible tattoos. All-American. There's already something in his eyes, thou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Mona sits back down, Max brushes past her to get his c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stands up from the couch and starts away. Confused, M tries to follow, but stumbles when something pulls her ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: he looks down to see she's been handcuffed to her chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? (beat, louder) Uncuff me. (beat, louder still) Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On screen, Lupino smiles, beads of sweat forming on his f Deliberately, Max stops the DVD and cuts off the televisi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W         MONA hat is this? You think just because he killed your partner, you can decide whether I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Max finally speaks, the sound scrapes out of his thr like he hasn't used his voice in years:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona struggles at the cuff, chain CLANKING but holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been inside that club.   You don't have a chance on your own. (realizing) But you don't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stoops down to pick up Mona's machine gun where it le against the base of the couch. Mona THRASHES helplessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want my help, because you think if he puts you out of your misery, you'll get to see her again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without a look back, Max starts out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope that's really the way it works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door pulls shut behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red neon sign is only an ember, muted under caked ice

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: n a chair blocking the front door, a GUARD watches the silent street, shivering uncontrollably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside, the dance floor is empty. Sitting at the top of t stairs, another GUARD sleeps, rifle propped beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room like the inside of a smoker's lung - walls painted black, haze from candles and whatever else blurring the a Jack Lupino sits on the floor surrounded by candles, watc the flames with manic focus. Two GUARDS stand above him.

dialogues.speaker: I
dialogues.text: nto a bent spoon, Lupino taps greenish powder from a smal glass vial. He uses the candle to heat the spoon. Checkin his watch, one of the guards produces a cell phone and di

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) All quiet, 4 a.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lupino dips a needle into the spoon, drawing the bubbling green liquid into the body of the syringe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard stomps his feet, trying in vain to keep some bl flowing. Blowing in his hands, he looks both ways down a street that is still just as empty as it has been for hou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chattering, to himself) Screw this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frozen fingers fumbling with the keys, the Guard opens th door. Moving the chair just inside the doorway, the guard settles in the alcove...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls the door shut. It won't. Something's blocking it The guard stands up, opens it wider to build some momentu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stands on the top step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lupino shoots up, gritted teeth tugging his belt tourniqu tight. Eyes clinched, beads of sweat already forming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The muffled BLAST of a machine gun, out on the dance floo The Guards surrounding Lupino spring into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W ait here, Mr. Lupino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lupino lets the belt slip free, a deep SIGH rattling out. opens his eyes, just in time for us to see the irises retracting. Candles shine in the black holes left behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need protection.   I have my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guards at the door lock and load, moving out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max walks into the ballroom, motionless Guard bleeding ou the dance floor before him. Gunsmoke hangs in the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that final stillness, Max checks his clip.     Stone-f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thundering BOOTS echo out from the belly of the building. Doors fly open - Guards racing out from the kitchen on th first floor, two more from the office CRASHING out upstai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax OPENS UP, flames of automatic fire lighting his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lupino and the Guards listen to the SHOOTING grow closer. Suddenly, the metal door flies open, BANGING at the stop. With lightning reflexes, THE GUARDS BLAST down the hallwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: upino slowly stands, eyes glowing in the guard's muzzle flash. Forgotten now, he fades away into the smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guards crumble and fall until the room goes SILENT.

dialogues.speaker: M
dialogues.text: ax melts out of the smoke, weapon raised.     Hunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back room is deeper than the poor light gives away. Max's boots grind over burned-out candles, occult runes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lupino launches out of the darkness at Max.   Before he s it coming, Lupino drives a hard punch into Max's skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stumbles forward, ears ringing from the blow. Lupino draws a gleaming knife from his boot and springs on Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: upino swings the knife so quickly it becomes a blur, blad WHISTLING as it cuts through the smoke. He slashes the kn across Max's thigh, dropping him to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: nable to stand, Max thrusts the rifle up for protection. The blade CLANKS against the barrel, carving deep trenche the stock, finally gashing the back of Max's fingers.

dialogues.text: The giant glass-walled penthouse office of the Aesir buil sits above the storm clouds. Up here, dawn is close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole Horne watches the storm below her feet.       She

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (even) This isn't a number you use.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: need you to send a helicopter to my building. NThe storm's breaking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: here was a shoot-out in my building yesterday, twenty floors from where I'm sitting. A secretary was killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand an executive named Jason Colvin was also among the dead. Senseless tragedies, all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole sighs, eyes still fixed on the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything's fine, we're just--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was more than you were ready for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps our partnership has run its course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think pretty hard about that. I'm about to be surrounded by Federal agents--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shadenfreude) Good heavens, BB. Best of luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who needs luck? They're going to love the stories I can tell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (losing it) Send the helicopter, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment, Horne lets her eyes drift shut.        Sh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on its away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens and BB steps out, snapping his phone s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take everybody and get downstairs.    I want no less than his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max turns the corner into a long hallway of prison-like offices. Emergency lights flicker through barred windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of GUARDS look up and see Max at the same moment. Max is without hesitation, SHOOTING two before they can r their weapons. Falling back, the others start FIRING...

dialogues.speaker: S
dialogues.text: uddenly, an office down the hall bursts to life - a ROAR flapping wings, light from the window strobing with movem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max doesn't seek cover, walking into BLAZING machine guns

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one, all the offices FLICKER with fluttering wings Max marches on, rage-filled eyes set in a lifeless face..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards empty the weapons lockers, loading for bear as the sounds of GUNFIRE grow closer. BB and Salle supervise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take some C4, wire it so he can't make it to the roof. I'll wait on the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salle's mistrust of BB is painted all over his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) You know I won't leave without you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max FIRES, plaster from shattered walls caking on his swe soaked skin. Guards take cover, fall back for position...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With every shot fired, the muzzle flash glows in Max's em black eyes, the flames glowing brighter as he advances...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...into the vast, open space at the heart of the building GUARDS appear at the other end of the hallway, OPENING UP Their SHOTS echo, the great room ringing like a cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max lifts his eyes - what had been four stories now seems like forty, the top not visible behind hazy black smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullets WHISTLE past Max's ear. Distracted, he RETURNS FI but his eyes are drawn back to the black smoke above. SOMETHING moves in the clouds, swirling closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More Guards THUNDER up steps littered with spent casings. their haste, they don't notice the thin gap in one window

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LENDER FINGERS slip in with the swirling snow, opening it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crashing back into Max's perspective, a RUSHING WIND pres down from the black clouds above, the darkness spreading. Max's legs buckle, his machine gun scattering SHOTS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room goes darker as it gets louder, light blotted out WINGED CREATURES drifting down from above, circling close

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stumbles, buffeted by their POUNDING WINGS. CHOKING o sulfurous smoke, hair smoldering, skin starting to singe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small group of Guards race forward, dodging the bodies others Max met along the way. They hesitate, form ranks..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and the frightened Guards charge into the great room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is silent. Smokeless. Just a hall. Blood streaks the walls, flows between the crumpled carcasses of more dead GUARDS. At the far end of the hall, something moves:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max. On his hands and knees, rivers of sweat flowing. Confused, the group of Guards approach Max. Weapons ready

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crushed inside the DEAFENING blackness, Max lifts his eye see LEERING DEMONS gazing down, distorted versions of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the four Guards, who look down on Max's trembling, swe logged body on the floor. He's MUTTERING, CHANTING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So easy it almost doesn't seem fair, a Guard aims his pis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, bullets RIP through the Guards from behind. No chance to respond, bodies torn open with a merciless BLAS machine gun fire. They fall around Max, joining the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun smoking, Mona rushes up the hallway to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Demons fade away, their howling SCREAMS lingering beh Awaiting the next horror, Max is shocked by something els White light splits open the smoke, cutting the black in t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona kneels down over Max, lifting up his head. Max's ski is pale, slick like melting wax. His eyes are empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing gentle in her touch - she SLAMS Max's hea back onto the cold marble, jerking him up again by his ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gradually, Max's black eyes start to find Mona's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The white light grows brighter, blasting away shadows and smoke. In its center, traces of Mona's face appear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max starts to sit up, gazing with confusion at the hallwa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have much time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max nods.    No idea if he understands, Mona helps him up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do what I can to slow them down, but you have to hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks back at Mona, clearly having some idea of what means for her. They look at each other for a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not done yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sickly light glows in the east. The snow has all but stopped. BB strides across the roof, hope in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) The weather's broken, your pilot is going to have no problem landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicole Horne sits at her desk, watching the storm recede.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A red light flashes on her phone.     She ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe Salle kneels over a pile of C4 bricks, wiring a bomb. tenses, hearing something in the hall behind him. Raising his hands and turning slowly, he finds Mona waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the detonator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, Salle holds it out for Mona.     She grabs the re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's more like this all over. Even if the building doesn't collapse, this floor is gone. (beat) Careful with that thing, is what I'm saying. I'm sure you and I can work something out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, BOOT STEPS ring up the hallway behind Mona.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop your weapon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salle smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max staggers through the door to BB's office. Out the big windows, the East River begins to glow with approaching d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax scans the room for BB, his vision still plagued by flickering shadows, hallucinations receding but not yet g He pauses at the glass, caught by his twisted reflection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ax can see his own wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salle holds out his hand for the detonator. Behind Mona, elevator doors open to reveal more Guards. They file out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the Guards) Hurry, Max's already upstairs. (to Mona, frustrated) Just hand it over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona watches the guards file towards the stairs. Behind h the elevator car waits, empty, the doors starting to clos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: B's done for, but this thing doesn't have to stop. I'm his number two, and somebody has to take over for Lupino. Like I said, we can work something out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever so casually, Mona takes a step back onto the elevato The doors HISS along their tracks, converging...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: frowning, confused) Give me one reason we can't do business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona presses the button on the detonator.

dialogues.speaker: T
dialogues.text: he window Max stands in front of SHATTERS in the EXPLOSIO his demonic image bursting into a thousand shards of glas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the ground, the explosion rains glass down over the and waiting SWAT team. Shielding his eyes, Bravura squint up at the flames in the windows. Taliente pats his should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to take Payne alive, if there's anything left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taliente nods.    On his signal, the SWAT team mobilizes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind GUSTS through the shattered windows of BB's office. brushes away diamonds of broken glass, struggling to stan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: hin rims of color have returned to his eyes. Human again. Max draws his pistol and strides through the roof door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shower of bullets strikes the doors as he steps outside Max can't react. Bullets shred the door behind him, one s hitting Max in the stomach and knocking him to the ground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: cross the roof, BB keeps FIRING until his pistol CLICKS. returns his attention to the sky, hopelessly waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's unbelievable. All that snow, and... Watch it end up being a beautiful day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ritting his teeth, Max struggles to his knees. Blood rush between his fingers, streaming out of the hole in his sid

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: earing Max's effort, BB turns away from the empty sky. Using the pistol as a crutch, Max finally stands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want my confession, first?   You came all this way for it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BB tosses his useless weapon aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock penitent) Forgive me, Max, for I have sinned. I should have bet more on you, and less on that helicopter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max limps closer, pistol swinging at his side.     A thin of blood follows behind him in the snow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BB watches Max's approach, his swagger rapidly failing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get to it, already. That's all I ask. You've earned it, so just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the pain in his stomach causing some difficulty, Max pulls the pistol's slide back to check for a live round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BB watches Max's preparations, terror growing. Unable to resist his panic, BB abruptly tries on a helpless smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I want you to listen to me, first. Just try to hear what--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max raises the pistol and PULLS THE TRIGGER. The slug hit BB in the center of the forehead, snapping his neck back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shell casing twirls down, landing in the snow without sound. BB's corpse lands a moment later with a clumsy THU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max lets the gun slip out of his hand and walks past the - BB's eyes frozen on the sky, red halo slowly expanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max reaches the edge, the river's black body revealed bel His gait falters, blood filling each footprint in the sno

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT team streams through the door, racing for the ro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max stands at the roof's edge. A stiff wind buffets again his chest, forcing his unsteady legs to sway a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, his eyes drift from the water below to the sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the doorway, Max watches Michelle smiling down at th baby, who grabs at her finger with a wide grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe in heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gently, Max takes a seat on the edge of the bed beside th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks up at the sky. Behind him, the SWAT team races outside, swarming and BARKING orders at Max, weapons rais

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max drops to his knees. He raises his hands, one dripping with his own blood. But his eyes stay on the sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have this idea about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where a tiny tear opens in the clouds, revealing steel grey dawn beyond.
